nodes.body:
### PR summary [80540f24f2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21772/commits/80540f24f2030f4de44c4587bfa198c2ff39d6ab)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`- quotientSpanXSubCAlgEquivAux1`
`- quotientSpanXSubCAlgEquivAux2`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (103.00, 0.20)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|522|-103|documentation nolint entries|

Current commit [80540f24f2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/80540f24f2030f4de44c4587bfa198c2ff39d6ab)
Reference commit [a04fb6f9b0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/a04fb6f9b0502ff624fa9e3e5bd1fe1e6fe4fb6c)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
And I should say: thanks a lot for tackling this large pile of technical debt!
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by j-loreaux.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13600669885/job/38026007050)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13600669885/job/38026006913)

Thanks! Just a few small comments.

maintainer delegate
One global comment, and one minor wording tweak

Thanks! Just a few small comments.

maintainer delegate

What do you think of using "coefficient" instead of "term"?
So maybe "The degree `3` coefficient of a cubic", etc...
Done.

I think for many notations it would be even better if you put the docstring on the identifier the notation refers to (like `Dioph.mod_dioph`) and then annotated the notation with `@[inherit_doc]`. What do you think?
Done.
My gut feeling prefers "with the fewest occurrences" (also below)

This is a general comment: I think doc-comments should end with a full stop if and only if they are complete sentences, so
/-- This is a really important consideration about their design. -/
but
/-- my favourite item -/

Can you adjust the new comments accordingly, please? (I'm aware this will be tedious work. Sorry.)
Once you've done so, I will review this promptly.
Done.
I would remove the full stop here.

```suggestion
/-- Disable reverification, even if the `CI` environment variable is set -/
```
@grunweg :ok:
You write "centres" here but "centers" below, choose one!
I must have left a rubber duck there. It has been fixed.
I think you should use the American spelling to match `Set.center`
Please don't forget this.

A bit more detail can't hurt
```suggestion
/-- `ð”¼[X]` is the expectation of `X`, defined as its Lebesgue integral. -/
```

```suggestion
  /-- Centres of the balls -/
```

```suggestion
  /-- The degree-3 coefficient -/
```
since the hover text will already include `self : Cubic`, and this is consistent with the other docstrings in this PR

Maybe
```suggestion
  /-- Sample an element of this type from the provided generator. -/
```

```suggestion
  /-- The degree-3 coefficient -/
  a : R
  /-- The degree-2 coefficient -/
  b : R
  /-- The degree-1 coefficient -/
  c : R
  /-- The degree-0 coefficient -/
```
Maybe `Execute` is better here and below
All done.

```suggestion
  /-- Sample a bounded element of this type from the provided generator. -/
```
Do we have an elaborator that avoids needing to repeat the docstring here? Can you ask on Zulip?

How about I change their docstrings to
```lean
/-- If this option is `true`, verify for `X says Y` that `X says` outputs `Y`. -/
register_option says.verify : Bool :=
  { defValue := false
    group := "says"
    descr := "Verify the output" }

/-- This option is only used in CI to negate `says.verify`. -/
register_option says.no_verify_in_CI : Bool :=
  { defValue := false
    group := "says"
    descr := "Disable reverification, even if the `CI` environment variable is set." }
```

```suggestion
  /-- The real part as an additive monoid homomorphism -/
```

```suggestion
  /-- The imaginary part as an additive monoid homomorphism -/
```

To match things like `Set.center`.
```suggestion
  /-- Centers of the balls -/
```
I think we don't actually want this docstring. It's just noise. I think `let rec`s shouldn't require them and we should update the linter instead.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: clear some `docBlame` nolints
